intros.DevOps: Skilled DevOps Engineer with 3+ years of hands-on experience supporting, automating, and optimizing mission critical deployments in AWS, leveraging configuration management, CI/CD, and DevOps processes.
intros.Back End: I have over 10 years of experience creating software using HTML, JavaScript, PHP and other languages, CSS, and databases. I’m passionate about performance, robustness, and maintainability in code, as well as integrity and collaboration in teams.
intros.Front End: This is the text of my Front End intro heading.
intros.User Experience: This is the text of my User Experience intro heading.
intros.User Interface: This is the text of my User Interface intro heading.
intros.Software Engineer: Skilled and results-oriented Software Engineer with more than 15 years of experience working in a variety of environments with a breadth of programs and technologies.
intros.Business: This is the text of my Business intro heading.
intros.Consulting: I have decades of experience creating software for and on the Internet. I believe in clear, forthright, and unambiguous communication and am passionate about performance, robustness, and maintainability in code, as well as integrity and collaboration in teams.
intros.Instructor: I have over 10 years of experience using Web technology. The best parts of that experience have always been when I could share or explain something complex to a junior developer, or when I could help solve a particularly puzzling problem.
intros.Team Lead: I am eager to use my broad experience and knowledge to help me lead your product development team to success.

skills.name: async/await
skills.description: The async function declaration defines an asynchronous function, which returns an AsyncFunction object. An asynchronous function is a function which operates asynchronously via the event loop, using an implicit Promise to return its result. But the syntax and structure of your code using async functions is much more like using standard synchronous functions.

recommendations.name: Philipp Tkachev
recommendations.title: Software Engineer
recommendations.relationship: Daniel J. worked with Philipp in the same group at Vivial Media
recommendations.recommendation: I used to work with Daniel for last couple years and he has proven himself as diligent and responsible colleague. Daniel did a great job making software fast and reliable. He is smart and knowledgeable. He strives to use modern technologies. Daniel was able to pickup all our internal complexity quickly and seamlessly. He discovered a tech debt and helped to eliminate it. It was a pleasure to work with Daniel and I would like to do it again.

recommendations.name: Michael Leo
recommendations.title: Owner, Kettle River Consulting Inc
recommendations.relationship: Daniel J. worked with Michael in the same group at RAZR Marketing
recommendations.recommendation: Daniel's knowledge of robust application development is practical, solid, and broad. Daniel and I worked on an "emergency implementation" that had to be done in about 1/4 the time it should have taken. We worked closely together and relied on each other strengths to deliver on time and make the customer extremely happy. Daniel was great to work with. He is an expert on the front-end and has solid knowledge of the back-end. I would love to work with him again.

recommendations.name: Christopher Smithson
recommendations.title: Software Innovation
recommendations.relationship: Christopher managed Daniel J. directly at RAZR Marketing
recommendations.recommendation: Daniel was brought to the team at a critical time in development and asked to take on substantial amounts of work with minimal orientation or guidance. I needed someone who was fluent in the more advanced aspects of PHP development and could tackle tough design and implementation decisions. He delivered on that demand at one of the highest proficiencies and accuracies that I have had the pleasure of working with. His ability to positively impact the short term needs of a project while also offering critical insights into the long term vision of the product is of great asset to anyone. He has an in depth understanding of product life cycles, software application design patterns, and system performance, among many other parallels. Ultimately his contract resulted in a successful mission. This is my highest level of recommendation.

recommendations.name: Natasha Gaffer
recommendations.title: Web App Developer
recommendations.relationship: Daniel J. worked with Natasha in the same group at Target Corporation
recommendations.recommendation: Daniel jumped right in developing a custom php interface to communicate with a brand-new CMS for Target.com. He worked solo with very demanding hours to bring my vision to life. He is confident about his work and dedicated to the project at hand. The tool has been incredibly successful so far and is scaling well as the project grows at an enterprise level.

recommendations.name: Joseph Piché
recommendations.title: Android and iOS Developer
recommendations.relationship: Joseph was a client of Daniel J.’s at Irish Titan
recommendations.recommendation: I worked alongside Daniel on an extremely difficult PHP project at Irish Titan, and am impressed with his ability to find security issues and bad programming practices that other programmers missed. Daniel is very detailed and thorough in all of his work, as well as very understanding of budget and time constraints.

recommendations.name: Darin Lynch
recommendations.title: Irish Titan
recommendations.relationship: Darin was a client of Daniel J.’s at Irish Titan
recommendations.recommendation: We hired Daniel to provide some very specific programming skills that are outside of our core competency here at Irish Titan. Daniel provided them in spades...he's very knowledgeable, and clearly an expert in his field. He was very good at explaining technical concepts to non-technical resources, and worked diligently and with alot of respect. We'd hire him again.

recommendations.name: Cevat Kerim Incedayi
recommendations.title: Software Developer
recommendations.relationship: Daniel J. worked with Cevat Kerim in the same group at U.S. Bank
recommendations.recommendation: Daniel is a very detailed individual. His ability to think beyond what is needed helps him produce robust solutions that can later be extended upon. I recommend him to any company seeking true programmers.

recommendations.name: Brian LaBounty
recommendations.title: Principal (Lead) Web Application Developer at Stratasys
recommendations.relationship: Daniel J. worked with Brian at Visible Customer
recommendations.recommendation: When it comes to working with new people and being patient and effective in giving the vital information necessary to get a new guy up to speed in a rapidly changing, intense environment, Daniel was the man who got me going fast, and got me ready to start contributing to the project faster than I thought possible. He's a good guy and would be an asset to any team, especially as a mentor.

recommendations.name: TQ White II
recommendations.title: Writing Software to Help Teachers Help Students
recommendations.relationship: Daniel J. worked with TQ at Visible Customer
recommendations.recommendation: Daniel is a very smart, capable developer. I continue to be impressed by his thoughtful approach to software, strong sense of clean architecture and awareness of maintainability. His code is clean and clever. He was always happy to help me with technical issues based on his thorough understanding of software and insightful knowledge of the technologies we used together. He's also an entertaining guy to have around. He's culturally aware and witty. I'd be very happy to work with him again.
